title: Arizona AG EO 14190

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any communication, guidance documents, reports, memos or other records regarding the U.S. Attorney General coordinating with the Arizona Attorney General to comply with executive order 14190 ("Ending Radical Indoctrination in K-12 Schooling") by enforcing the law and filing appropriate actions against K-12 teachers and school officials who violate the law by:
(i) sexually exploiting minors;
(ii) unlawfully practicing medicine by offering diagnoses and treatment without the requisite license; or
(iii) otherwise unlawfully facilitating the social transition of a minor student.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Trans Journalists Association

title: California DOE letters

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The March 27, 2025, letter received by the California Department of Education from the United States Department of Education Student Privacy Policy Office regarding an investigation into compliance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act in relation to California Assembly Bill 1955. 2. Additional communication from the U.S. Department of Education to all Chief State Schools Officers and all Superintendents of Local Educational Agencies regarding obligations under FERPA, sent on March 28, 2025. 3. Any response from the California Department of Education, school officers and/or superintendents to the U.S. Department of Education. 4. Any communication between the California Department of Education, school officers and/or superintendents about federal communication or investigation.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Trans Journalists Association

title: CIA support for 2025 film "The Amateur"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA support for 2025 film "The Amateur"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Central Intelligence Agency and the production of the 2025 feature film "The Amateur," directed by James Hawes. Such documents may include but should not be not limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of the CIA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Amateur," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007 & 2008.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I did not see any of these reports on the following website:  https://utsports.com/sports/2019/8/7/financial.aspx

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

title: FBI Documents for Stephen Coppola

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI Documents for Stephen Coppola
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records related to Stephen F. Coppola (AKA: Stefano, Steve, Steven, Stephan):

FBI File #240905.  
DOD: June 2, 1984  

Search Directions:

1. Please use Stephen’s FBI File #240905 as the starting place for your search. 

2. Further, please conduct a search for records at the FBI Field Office in Buffalo, NY. 

3. Also conduct an additional search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the following:

A. The  Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices

B. The Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, 

C. The Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, 

D. And the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, 

4. In the above searches please include:  Both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. 

5. Additionally, please conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center. 

6. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. 

7. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

8. I have included a screenshot of a document about Stephen Copppla from  the former The Bureau of Narcotics (which morphed into the DEA). This screenshot verifies Coppola had an FBI file and the FBI file number is/or was : 240905. 

9. In the advent of a negative response please detail all efforts that were made to find these documents via the directions mentioned above.

The Bureau of Narcotics described Stephen as follows:

"He is a wholesaler and distributor of illicit alcohol in the Western NY area. Obtains narcotics from other Mafiosi in NYC and wholesales these drugs in the Buffalo area. Also engaged in smuggling contraband across the U.S. - Canadian border. His brother Salvatore (deceased) was  highly respected among the Mafia Hierarchy in Western NY-Southern Ontario area."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mob

title: USCIS: Screening of social media activity

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USCIS: Screening of social media activity
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any policies, guidance, training, or directives to DHS or USCIS staff or agents concerning the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services' "consider[ation] of aliens' antisemitic activity on social media and the physical harassment of Jewish individuals as grounds for denying immigration benefit requests," as announced in an April 9, 2025, press release available at https://www.uscis.gov/newsroom/news-releases/dhs-to-begin-screening-aliens-social-media-activity-for-antisemitism.

2. Any search terms, queries, or programming used to identify content on social media for consideration in denying immigration benefit requests.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 6 CFR § 5.5(e)(1)(ii) and (iv) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and free expression, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social). Federal agencies have granted my requests for expedited processing and full fee waivers on the basis that I seek information relevant to urgent news stories and matters of public interest.

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the Department of Homeland Security's response to an Executive Order concerning activity or expression that may be protected by the First Amendment, and the Department's announcement that USCIS will monitor social media.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below, which are helpful in establishing that there is an urgency to inform the public on this topic. The Department of Homeland Security issued a press release announcing the activity, reflecting its conclusion that information about the activity is worthy of immediate public attention.

In addition to the significant range of news coverage relating to the Trump administration's response to anti-semitism, particularly as it relates to higher education, examples of recent articles demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include articles published immediately after this morning's press release, which are likely to multiply in the hours and days ahead:

a. https://www.npr.org/2025/04/09/g-s1-59149/immigrants-social-media-antisemitism-dhs
b. https://news.bloomberglaw.com/daily-labor-report/uscis-to-screen-immigrants-social-media-for-antisemitism
c. https://www.theblaze.com/news/exclusive-immigration-agency-to-scour-social-media-to-prevent-foreign-pro-terror-anti-semites-from-getting-benefits

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 6 CFR § 5.11(k), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to controversial conduct by United States officials in response to campus protests.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Correctional Officers as Truancy Officers (Norfolk County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Correctional Officers as Truancy Officers (Norfolk County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records that detail the extent to which correctional officers and other Sheriff Department employees act as truancy officers from January 1, 2023 to the time this request is filled. Specifically, I request records that show the name and title of sheriff department employees who act as truancy officers, the school districts where they have worked, and any training or certification that the employee has received related to work as a truancy officer.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Dankoff

title: FOIA Log FY2024

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Log FY2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request a copy of the FOIA log maintained by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers. Specifically, I am requesting the log for the fiscal year of 2024 on the subject of urban flooding, flooding as a natural disaster and flood mitigation. 

If the log could please contain the following information:

The request number or tracking number.

The date the request was received.

A brief description of the records requested.

The name or office of the agency official responsible for the request.

The current status of the request (e.g., pending, completed, denied).

The final disposition or outcome of the request (e.g., released in full, released in part, denied).

If possible, could the log please be provided in a CSV / XLS accessible format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Britton Struthers-Lugo

communications.subject: RE: FOIA Request - Clarification Requested
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Struthers-Lugo,

Your FOIA request was received in the Chicago District by email on April 10, 2025. Our FOIA tracking system is offline until Monday, so I am unable to provide a tracking number today. When the tracking system is online again, I will get a tracking number and provide it to you.

You are requesting a FOIA log for the fiscal year 2024 and are particularly interested in the subject of urban flooding, flooding as a natural disaster, and flood mitigation. Before I begin processing the request, please clarify a couple items for me:


  1.  Are you requesting information from the Chicago District only, or are you requesting information from the entire U.S. Army Corps of Engineers?


  1.  We will have to extract the requested information from our FOIA tracking system since we do not regularly prepare FOIA logs. We should be able to extract a report that shows all the requests for fiscal year 2024, but we can also limit the report to those requests that contain certain keywords in the description. Would you like us to search for specific terms when extracting the information or would you like us to run a report that reflects all FOIA requests for fiscal year 2024? If you would like us to search for specific terms, which terms would you like us to use?

The processing time will begin upon receipt of your clarification.

I look forward to hearing from you.

Very Respectfully,

Jenna McCreary
Paralegal Specialist
U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Chicago District
231 S. LaSalle Street, Suite 1500
Chicago, IL 60604
Office:  312.846.5332
Cell:  312.504.9883

title: Cybercheck communications & contracts

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Cybercheck communications & contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents since Jan. 1, 2021 between Chattanooga Police Department and Global Intelligence Inc. (also called Cybercheck or Cybercheck.AI) for the provision of the Cybercheck service.

2. Email exchanges, including attachments, between Chattanooga Police Department staff and email addresses with the domain "@cybercheck.ai" between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

3. Emails, including attachments, between staff of Chattanooga Police Department that reference Cybercheck or its provider Global Intelligence, sent between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present. 

4. A copy of the 911 call audio and transcript related to the murder of 20-year-old Omar Escobar on Willow Street that took place on Sept. 27, 2021

I kindly ask that you waive all fees as I am a journalist making the request on behalf of a Canadian broadcaster and the requested records will be used for journalism in the public interest. (For further context, please see these news articles: https://archive.is/5FHPz and https://www.nbcnews.com/news/crime-courts/ai-tool-used-thousands-criminal-cases-facing-legal-challenges-rcna149607.) If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfil the request. Please let me know if anything is unclear.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Jessica Hatcher.

Your public information request has been received in the City of Chattanooga Open Records office on 4/9/2025 and given the reference number W050465-040925 for tracking purposes. (https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.PYICgxP3kfgZjR-2B4e9nPlCpLTRfuLgXG25k-2Bb0phI-2FnW-2FTd6iRveHKBAga8I9q9W7-2FpmAz5-2F7U2uJSme-2Femn5nES5sQgbjveVmxLnvqz-2F4-2BV7UKxpkxMjT-2Ff1vbGhRob-2FjT5H9qaurrj5Udfbx1yjw-3D-3D3yuf_UQvOZjLdwNmo9GuukfrcePnzdc1T3TVAKUrSTTLMH5Krg9KeWnLQEzu9vX4XKbTYh9nN-2B5cxo5H00YMCff-2B6xzdHeo-2BfUbAMkA4fXzGB3GsSi0-2B9ktxY7TvxFuFbrX5zzNXAPic8S-2Bi7Gp8iN7-2FhqXBADzLFSedaPqNXw5e0MA0EuqTyOES2xtBDXGGkYrhKliYHApDng9HyrPBLadD0Qvm-2FusJvqos68Vkwd-2F7K8VCBNxkY-2BU6vrch0U-2BFYWFgDOnKXmqlNg209bwcfu-2FsCxqVtMWppa6JnmtMHyKnayIRyCpZjbc-2B2cKky910yGZSbwk6Y5caz5zz4F3FDqKLWzee8PXBUN8ED5EwbRxWSIZBMNFcxcV46T52RgeElDI7aoKi-2BvdQzHqjv0YAVdAIy5w-3D-3D) 
 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents since Jan. 1, 2021 between Chattanooga Police Department and Global Intelligence Inc. (also called Cybercheck or Cybercheck.AI) for the provision of the Cybercheck service.

2. Email exchanges, including attachments, between Chattanooga Police Department staff and email addresses with the domain "@cybercheck.ai" between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

3. Emails, including attachments, between staff of Chattanooga Police Department that reference Cybercheck or its provider Global Intelligence, sent between Jan. 1, 2021 and the present.

4. A copy of the 911 call audio and transcript related to the murder of 20-year-old Omar Escobar on Willow Street that took place on Sept. 27, 2021

I kindly ask that you waive all fees as I am a journalist making the request on behalf of a Canadian broadcaster and the requested records will be used for journalism in the public interest. (For further context, please see these news articles: https://archive.is/5FHPz and https://www.nbcnews.com/news/crime-courts/ai-tool-used-thousands-criminal-cases-facing-legal-challenges-rcna149607.) If you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation of the employee hours required to fulfil the request. Please let me know if anything is unclear.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Jessica Hatcher

title: Bolinas Community Center and County of Marin Food Grant

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Bolinas Community Center and County of Marin Food Grant
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All email communications from "Kevin.wright@marincounty.gov" to any employee, agent, or board member of Bolinas Community Center between January 1st, 2020 to April 8th, 2025 - as well as all document attachments contained within those email communication.

All grant contracts executed between the Bolinas Community Center and the County of Marin, or any entity connected to the County of Marin. 

All invoices submitted by Bolinas Community Center to the County of Marin between January 1st, 2020 to April 8th, 2025

All reports submitted by the Bolinas Community Center to the County of Marin between January 1st, 2020 to April 8th, 2025

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson
